did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Papers, photographs, correspondence, posters, videotapes, audiotapes, 8mm film reels, CDs, musical score, press releases, ephemera, items of clothing, birth and death certificates, scrapbooks, autobiographical essay.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The Goldstaub family papers relate to the effect on the family of Sylvia and Bernie Goldstaub when their son Mark came out to them as a gay man in 1977 and later when he became HIV-positive. The collection includes an audiotape of "Venetian Echoes" composed by Paul Goldstaub in memory of Mark, as well as the score and program notes. Also materials relating to Sylvia's book Unconditional Love: Mom! Dad! Love Me Please!

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Mark Goldstaub was born April 24, 1951 and died from an AIDS-related illness December 14, 1988. He worked as a publicist in New York City for entertainers including Shirley MacLaine. He is survived by his parents, his brother Paul Goldstaub, and his partner, Edmund Wojcik.

Motivated to share her family's story and to persuade other parents to continue to love their gay children, Sylvia Goldstaub wrote a book in Mark's honor,
Unconditional Love: Mom! Dad! Love Me Please! Sylvia has toured the country speaking about her book and her experiences at book stores, religious groups, and AIDS fund-raising events. Sylvia and Bernie have been active members of Parents and Friends of Lesbians and Gays in Florida. Paul Goldstaub, a professor of music, composed "Venetian Echoes" as a tribute to Mark.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p:
Documents include Mark Goldstaub's birth certificate, his tallis and yarmulke, family photographs and correspondence; posters and other material relating to Mark Goldstaub's work and experience with AIDS; videotapes of interviews with Sylvia Goldstaub; a videotape of a public lecture by Sylvia Goldstaub concerning the response of families of PWAs; audiotapes of interviews with Sylvia and Bernie Goldstaub; tape of "Venetian Echoes" composed by Paul Goldstaub, the score, and program notes; correspondence and condolences; folder of material on PFLAG (Parents and Friends of Lesbians and Gays); press releases and biographical information for the family; ephemera collected by Sylvia Goldstaub relating to AIDS activism; a crew jacket for Shirley MacLaine's 1984 Broadway show, for which Mark was publicist; file on AIDS Watch '93, a lobbying effort; and letters of support from people and organizations in response to Sylvia's book
Unconditional Love: Mom! Dad! Love Me Please! Includes additional personal material of Mark Goldstaub: birth and death certificates, childhood scrapbooks and autobiographical essay, 1981-1983 photo album; program for memorial service and correspondence of the family of Mark's partner, Edmund Wojcik.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Parents & Friends of Lesbians and Gays.

1958 July Paul leaving for Camp Minisink(?): 1958 July 13 Mark's play at Cabana Club; 1958 July Camp Minisink(?); 1958 Sept. First day school- Paul's first scout hike Oct. 1958; 1959 Mar. Paul's 6th grade play and magic(?); 1959 June Mark's 2nd grade play; 1960 Apr. new home; May 1960 Memorial Day
1958 Miss Sloan, Mark 5th grade; Air Force day May 7 1958
Paul's Bar Mitzvah, June 4 1960, Irvington Home Irvington, NJ

June 19 1960 Sylvia and Bernie 15th anniversary; Sept.1960 1st day school to Mark's 10th birthday April 24 1961; 1961 July Cape Cod; 1961 Sept. First day school; 1961 Dec. Ice skating; 1962 June 1, Feb. 2

Paul senior Mark 8th grade and Jr. High; 1965 June Paul graduation from Columbia HS; 1965 Sept. 1967 March Paul (Jr.) Columbia HS; 1967 Paul (Jr.) Ithaca College; 1968 Sept.
